posts.post_content:
**![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol): Destroy target [creature enchantment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=130691).**   
  
Oh wait, Lucent Liminid is an Enchantment Creature, not a Creature Enchantment. Damn, I mislinked. Ah well, it's still a funny intersection of old wording and new cards. =)

posts.post_content: This was the 200th Magic card which name started with D if we count the Urza's Legacys cards in alphabetical order. If in collector's number order then it's [Defense Grid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Defense Grid).

Posted By: tavaritz (8/25/2011 1:42:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Interesting. Unfortunately, aura is unpopular in competitive environment due to instability.  
Yes, it can destroy [Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Umbra)s, and other popular enchantments in casual like [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor) (well, delay is better word here).   
However, due to very narrow appliances, I think this deserves 2/5

posts.post_content: Very handy, very cheap. Gets rid of all those nasty enchantments empowering your opponets creatures or the ones tormenting your's. Also makes your opponent hold on to his or her creature enchantments rather than cast them.
